page.title: 16DISUSED QUARRIES
page.content: On our grid we have lots of disused quarries.Many of them are over 100 years old with big trees and weeds growing all over them.One we saw looked like a small wood until we got close to it and saw how deeply it was cut into the ground.{Stubbs Quarry is {now used as a council rubbish dump. Opened 7 years ago they handle{council {dustbin lorries and 30 private lorries {a day.Skips arrive from as far away as {Leeds,Wetherby and Sheffield,}these customers paying for their loads.There are 2 large skips in the entrance for household and garden waste. There are 5 employees at the dump with 3 machines for compacting and covering the waste. {It is planned for the dump to close in {January 1986 and to re-open at another {disused quarry nearby.
